text: Does anyone know why the Rich Text editor wraps text in `span`s rather than formatting the original element itself? It’s causing a bunch of headaches for me and my team because things aren’t formatting correctly and they need me to look into the source code to fix it. <https://d.pr/i/nI4L6p>
why not make it so the template or the module sets the styles for H1's H2's H3's?
Sometimes we change the background color for a single page and need to adjust the text accordingly. :confused:

I usually build in a toggle switch for  “text on dark background” then the styles are still managed by the module or template and are consistent site wide. then the content editor just flips the switch and is happy

Hey guys! Happy Wednesday! This user is looking to implement a rating system (so users can rate blog posts) to their blog template. Any thoughts, suggestions or tips to help get them started would be great: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Blog-Website-Page-Publishing/How-can-we-add-Star-Rating-system-to-our-blog-posts/m-p/244076>
That could be cool. Is that basically a custom module with a rich text editor and a switch?

Hi again! I have a user who is looking to use the Schema App with their website. Has anyone heard of the Schema App, or had experience getting the javascript to work on a HubSpot website? <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/Schema-App-Javascript-in-HubSpot/m-p/243734>
I provide an answer with a way I use on our website and clients. Hope it will suit :slightly_smiling_face:
